page.title: 18Mrs Hazeldine of Ranton (II)
page.content: Mrs Hazeldine is now a widow. Mr Hazel- dine died of a stroke in 1982. They used to breed donkeys but when her husband died Mrs Hazeldine sold all the animals except one. Mrs Hazeldine doesn't go to market at all now because she has retired from farming. She isn't a member of any village societies but she does go to church. When the Hazeldines came to Ranton 34 years ago there was no sanitation or electricity. The present house that Mrs Hazeldine lives in was build about 1780 but a lot has been extended and modern- ised. The farm wasn't passed down through generations of her family. The house has four bedrooms and there is a view of Stafford Castle. Mrs Hazeldine just does ordinary domestic jobs such as housework, cooking and gardening.
